channel.title: Nicholas Adamou's Notes
channel.description: I am a full stack software engineer who is on a mission to make the world a better place through code.

item.title: 7 Steps to Successfully Onboard to a New Codebase
item.description: Jumping into a new codebase can feel overwhelming, especially in fast-paced engineering teams. Here are seven practical steps to streamline your onboarding and set yourself up for success.

item.title: A Deeper Than Not Dive into Two Sum
item.description: Explore the infamous LeetCode problem #1, Two Sum, with a deep dive into its naive and optimized solutions, including a discussion on Hash Maps, binary search, and memory management.

item.title: Building a Simple Load Balancer with Spring Boot
item.description: Learn how to build a basic load balancer using Spring Boot, featuring health checks and round-robin distribution.

item.title: Handling Large File Uploads (20GB+) in Fast API with S3 Multipart Upload Using Signed URLs
item.description: Learn how to handle large file uploads in Fast API using S3 multipart upload with signed URLs, ensuring efficient and secure file transfers.

item.title: Minimizing Nesting for Readable and Maintainable Code
item.description: Explore how reducing nesting in functions enhances readability and maintainability, with practical examples that illustrate best practices.

item.title: The Power of Stacked Diffs: A Strategy for Better Code Reviews
item.description: Discover the benefits of using stacked diffs to make code reviews easier and faster. Learn how breaking up large PRs into smaller, logical units enhances readability, reduces reviewer fatigue, and improves overall code quality.

item.title: Trading Space for Time: Boosting Algorithm Efficiency
item.description: Explore how trading space for time can significantly improve the efficiency of an algorithm using a practical example of counting bad pairs in an array.

item.description: A deep dive into one of the simplest yet most destructive shell payloads â€” the fork bomb.

item.title: Worker Threads in Node.js: The Secret to High Performance Backends
item.description: Node.js is famously single-threadedâ€”but when you hit CPU-heavy operations like encryption, data processing, or image resizing, your app can grind to a halt. That's where Worker Threads come in.
